intro: Labordia fagraeoidea var. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern labordia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
